sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The free-holders grand inquest touching our Sovereign Lord the King and his Parliament to which are added observations upon forms of government : together with directions for obedience to governours in dangerous and doubtful times / by the learned Sir Robert Filmer, Knight. Filmer, Robert, Sir, d. 1653.
372 p. in various pagings : port.
[s.n.]. London : MDCLXXIX [1679]
After "The author's preface" follow three special title pages: Reflections concerning the original of government ..., London, 1679 -- The anarchy of a limited or mixed monarchy ..., London, 1679 -- An advertisement to the jury-men of England touching witches ..., London, 1679. Imperfect: tightly bound with loss of print. Reproduction of original in the Harvard Law School Library. The free-holders grand inquest -- Observations upon Aristole's Politiques touching forms of government -- Directions for obedience to government in dangerous or doubtful times -- Observations concerning the original of government -- The anarchy of a limited or mixed monarchy -- An advertisement to the jury-men of England touching witches.
=======
The free-holders grand inquest touching our Sovereign Lord the King and his Parliament to which are added observations upon forms of government : together with directions for obedience to governours in dangerous and doubtful times / by the learned Sir Robert Filmer, Knight. Filmer, Robert, Sir, d. 1653.
372 p. in various pagings : port.
[s.n.]. London : MDCLXXIX [1679]
After "The author's preface" follow three special title pages: Reflections concerning the original of government ..., London, 1679 -- The anarchy of a limited or mixed monarchy ..., London, 1679 -- An advertisement to the jury-men of England touching witches ..., London, 1679. Imperfect: tightly bound with loss of print. Reproduction of original in the Harvard Law School Library. The free-holders grand inquest -- Observations upon Aristole's Politiques touching forms of government -- Directions for obedience to government in dangerous or doubtful times -- Observations concerning the original of government -- The anarchy of a limited or mixed monarchy -- An advertisement to the jury-men of England touching witches.
